title.narrative: Support for resilient livelihoods in the South of Madagascar

description.narrative: The PDO are to improve access to basic infrastructure and livelihood opportunities and strengthen local governance in southern Madagascar with a primary focus on youth and women, and to provide a rapid and effective response to the Food Security Crisis and other Eligible Crisis or Emergency.

condition.narrative: Section I.A.3.(d) of Schedule 2: no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall recruit and appoint (i)one senior accountant, (ii) one additional accountant, and (iii) one internal auditor, on the basis of terms of reference,integrity, qualifications and experience acceptable to the Association.

Section I.A.3.(e) of Schedule 2: No later than December 31, 2021, or any later date agreed upon in writing with the Association,the Recipient shall recruit an external auditor in accordance with the Procurement Regulations, in a manner and with qualificationssatisfactory to the Association, and with terms of reference covering the Project, including this additional financing.

Section I.G. of Schedule 2: The Recipient shall ensure that not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, a NationalDisaster Preparedness Plan is prepared and adopted in form and substance acceptable to the Association

The Recipient shall, no later than twelve (12) months after effectiveness, establish and maintain, throughout the course of theProject implementation, selected SLCs with mandate, composition and resources acceptable to the Association, all as further definedin the PIM.
